Title: Aesthetic Affordances of Buto's Shape and Texture Characters in Wayang Kulit Through Digital Sculpting
Source title: ICSECC 2019 - International Conference on Sustainable Engineering and Creative Computing: New Idea, New Innovation, Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Visual Communication Design Department, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ardiyan, A., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Visual Communication Design Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Syamsuddin, D., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Visual Communication Design Department, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Javanese Wayang Kulit Puppetry through centuries has become high values for the Indonesian cultural aspect, normatively this monumental culture is also has become iconic sublime through 'pakem', its means, Wayang Kulit has the uniformity performance, including the storyline and the method of the delivering the story to protect the tradition, as a cultural asset Wayang should have progress in other unlimited creativity, rather than stagnant or involutif. Until now, Wayang Kulit became inspiration and thrills factor of creativity using the technology, such as in game, wayang has become playable game character, including the heroic and the vilain approaches from the original wayang characterization itself. The purpose of this research is to describe the creatives process and technical approach using digital sculpting that focus on shape and texture design of wayang kulit character, especially in 'Buto' type of character, which is refers to giant monster based on humanoid wayang type. The methods of this research combine literatures study and experimental 3D CG model character creation. The analysis result is to gain alternative visualization in character design, focus on shape and texture from conceptual to visualization aesthetic that inspired by Wayang Buto type characterization. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: 3D Character Design; Digital Sculpting; Javanese Wayang Kulit; Shape Design; Texture Design
Index Keywords: 3D modeling; Sustainable development; Visualization; 3D characters; Character designs; Cultural aspects; Cultural assets; Digital Sculpting; Javanese Wayang Kulit; Shape and textures; Shape designs; Textures

Authors: Syamsuddin D., Wijaya V., Bernando A.
Title: The phenomenon of blusukan strategy with 3D AVATAR concept in political campaign of West Java governor (A case study: Mr Ridwan Kamil and Mr Uu Ruzhanuk Ulum as candidate election)
Affiliations: Animation Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Syamsuddin, D., Animation Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, V., Animation Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bernando, A., Animation Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to answer the question: Is AVATAR's political campaign method unable to replace the original figure of the candidate for Governor of West Java, Ridwan Kamil, so as to convince them to vote. This study is focus on the phenomenon of communication involving 3D Virtual elements in the form of AVATAR, the candidate pair of West Java Governor, Ridwan Kamil, in order to greet and conduct dialogues directly toward the prospective voters in remote isolated area of Western Java that is not reached by the internet network, using the fleet campaign car as much as 6 fleets in which there is a campaign tool that one of them conceptualize duplication of Ridwan Kamil character in the form of 3D Avatar. The research method chosen is from Schutz's phenomenomology based on the meaning of the reaction to the avatar campaign method of the candidate pair of West Java governor Ridwan Kamil in pilikada 2018. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Governors; 3D Avatars; Campaign tools; Phenomenomology; Political campaign; research methods; Virtual elements; West javas; Three dimensional computer graphics

Authors: Sasongko H., Riyadi T., Syamsuddin D.
Title: Motion study of traditional martial arts as visual inspirations for character design style
Affiliations: Animation Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sasongko, H., Animation Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Riyadi, T., Animation Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Syamsuddin, D., Animation Program, Visual Communication Design Department, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Watching action flicks, which feature some martial art fight between characters, can be very entertaining. The martial art fight and movement is usually the primary appeal and selling point. In the animation media such as movies or games, the animator does not necessarily have to be a practitioner of any martial art system but the animator will certainly going to need materials to study as references. This study aims to create alternative styles and poses of character design inspired by traditional martial art styles that often appear in various pictures, comics, and movies. Other goals are also to provide the animators a comprehensive and easy to use reference, for an easier and more effective level of animation production. Method of research is through the stages of observation and demonstration of the movements in the form of digitized data captured from a practitioner of traditional martial art movements, dissecting every meaning, purposes, and philosophy behind movements of the martial arts style. Finding and understanding the core concept of martial art body mechanic and philosophy behind its movements is crucial before turning it into re-illustration art of design. The result is a distinctive visual style and motion with unique traditional martial art poses. This method is expected to be a guide that makes animator has better understanding in the traditional martial art unique and distinctive body mechanic poses. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Physics; Body mechanics; Character designs; Digitized data; Martial art; Motion study; Animation
References: Aditya, D.K., (2008), Revitalisasi Karakter Komik Superhero Lokal Indonesia Di Tengah-Tengah Dominasi Budaya Komik Global Master Theses Bandung; Latif, N., (2012) Perancangan Komik Fotografi Pramodawardhani, , (Yogyakarta: Pasca Sarjana ISI Yogyakarta); Ahmad, A.P.S., (2012) Perancangan Maskot Jakarta, , (Yogyakarta: Pasca Sarjana ISI Yogyakarta); Klein, C., (2004) Martial Arts and Globalization of US and Asian Film Industries, 2 (3), p. 360. , (USA: Massachusetts Institue of Technology)
Conference name: 1st International Conference on Advance and Scientific Innovation, ICASI 2018

Authors: Fadillah C., Syamsuddin D., Sasongko R.
Title: The power of perspective on toys photography in one frame story
Affiliations: School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fadillah, C., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Syamsuddin, D., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sasongko, R., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Toys Photography is a phenomenon that is still prevalent today. The emergence of toys photography has many reasons including the need of stories line as a way to make the toy characters come alive, and also closely related to the world of animation that carries a lot of scenes or stories in the toy industry. The emergence of toy products is also because of film production or advertisement as a medium for distributing the film or as a hobby either from animation and photography world itself. A perspective or viewpoint is very influential for scene or visual story. Thus it require different technique and handling between photos product with normal human eye perspective and smaller objects perspective of such as characters on toy products. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
References: Giwanda, G., (2001) Menciptakan Foto Yang Menarik, , Puspaswara tt, Jakarta; Giwanda, G., (2001) Panduan Belajar Fotografi, , Puspaswara tt, Jakarta
Correspondence Address: Fadillah, C.; School of Design, Indonesia
